intro: Peponium grandiflorum, commonly known as the large-flowered pumpkin, is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family. It is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers and elongated, edible fruits that resemble pumpkins. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It thrives in warm climates with well-drained soil and requires full sun for optimal growth. Its botanical features make it both ornamental and useful for culinary purposes.
